pull.title: fuzz: Exit and log stderr for parse_test_list errors
pull.body: We should log all errors that occur when attempting to print the harness list in the fuzz test runner.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage
For detailed information about the code coverage, see the [test coverage report](https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/29304).
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [maflcko](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29304#issuecomment-1907966782) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

This is currently a problem in the qa-assets CI, listing the harnesses fails but there is no output: https://cirrus-ci.com/task/5433841842651136?logs=ci#L9235

```
...
+ test/fuzz/test_runner.py -j6 -l DEBUG /ci_container_base/ci/scratch/qa-assets/fuzz_seed_corpus/ --empty_min_time=60
No fuzz targets found
```

rename.from: fuzz: Exit and log stdout for parse_test_list errors
rename.to: fuzz: Exit and log stderr for parse_test_list errors

events.message: fuzz: Exit and log stderr for parse_test_list errors

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -366,15 +366,21 @@ def job(t, args):
 
 
 def parse_test_list(*, fuzz_bin):
-    test_list_all = subprocess.run(
+    res = subprocess.run(
         fuzz_bin,
         env={
             'PRINT_ALL_FUZZ_TARGETS_AND_ABORT': ''
         },
         stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
-        stderr=subprocess.DEVNULL,
+        stderr=subprocess.STDOUT,
comments.body: Why redirect it to stdout, then read stdout, and then print it to stderr? Wouldn't it be easier to just remove this line and thus inherit stderr?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -366,15 +366,21 @@ def job(t, args):
 
 
 def parse_test_list(*, fuzz_bin):
-    test_list_all = subprocess.run(
+    res = subprocess.run(
         fuzz_bin,
         env={
             'PRINT_ALL_FUZZ_TARGETS_AND_ABORT': ''
         },
         stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
-        stderr=subprocess.DEVNULL,
+        stderr=subprocess.STDOUT,
         text=True,
-    ).stdout.splitlines()
+    )
+
+    if res.returncode != 0:
+        logging.error(f"Binary returned an error (code: {res.returncode}) while trying to list harnesses:\n{res.stdout}")
+        sys.exit(1)
+
+    test_list_all = res.stdout.splitlines()
comments.body: This will now include stderr, because it was redirected to stdout, no? Seems easier to keep them separate?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -366,15 +366,21 @@ def job(t, args):
 
 
 def parse_test_list(*, fuzz_bin):
-    test_list_all = subprocess.run(
+    res = subprocess.run(
         fuzz_bin,
         env={
             'PRINT_ALL_FUZZ_TARGETS_AND_ABORT': ''
         },
         stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
-        stderr=subprocess.DEVNULL,
+        stderr=subprocess.STDOUT,

@@ -366,15 +366,20 @@ def job(t, args):
 
 
 def parse_test_list(*, fuzz_bin):
-    test_list_all = subprocess.run(
+    res = subprocess.run(
         fuzz_bin,
         env={
             'PRINT_ALL_FUZZ_TARGETS_AND_ABORT': ''
         },
         stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
-        stderr=subprocess.DEVNULL,
         text=True,
-    ).stdout.splitlines()
+    )
+
+    if res.returncode != 0:
+        logging.error(f"Binary returned an error (code: {res.returncode}) while trying to list harnesses")
+        sys.exit(1)
comments.body: This can also be removed, by simply using `check=True,`, to get the same details, and even a traceback, no?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -366,15 +366,20 @@ def job(t, args):
 
 
 def parse_test_list(*, fuzz_bin):
-    test_list_all = subprocess.run(
+    res = subprocess.run(
         fuzz_bin,
         env={
             'PRINT_ALL_FUZZ_TARGETS_AND_ABORT': ''
         },
         stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
-        stderr=subprocess.DEVNULL,
         text=True,
-    ).stdout.splitlines()
+    )
+
+    if res.returncode != 0:
+        logging.error(f"Binary returned an error (code: {res.returncode}) while trying to list harnesses")
+        sys.exit(1)

@@ -372,8 +372,8 @@ def parse_test_list(*, fuzz_bin):
             'PRINT_ALL_FUZZ_TARGETS_AND_ABORT': ''
         },
         stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
-        stderr=subprocess.DEVNULL,
         text=True,
+        check=True,
comments.body: For reference, this check is fine to do since fa22966f330 changed the abort into a successful exit.
